title: 'People who are saying ... ': Shashi Tharoor responds to Kerala Congress snub
content: Shashi Tharoor faced backlash from Kerala Congress leaders who accused sohim of undermining the party line and siding with the Modi government. Tharoor questioned the credibility of his critics and defended his stance, emphasizing national interest over party loyalty. Despite internal pressure, Congress leadership appears unwilling to expel Tharoor, suggesting he should leave on his own.

title: 'Will do what we need to do': India takes tough stand on EU sanctions over Russian oil
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Modi's UK visit, foreign secretary Vikram Misri on Tuesday addressed concerns over Western pressure regarding Russian oil imports, emphasizing India's priority is its energy security. He cautioned against double standards in the global energy market, highlighting the need for balance and perspective amidst the European security crisis.

title: Watch: US cops smash Black man's car window, punch him in face at traffic stop
content: A Jacksonville officer, D. Bowers, faces consequences after a video surfaced showing him punching William McNeil Jr. during a traffic stop. McNeil was initially pulled over for allegedly driving without headlights. Sheriff T.K. Waters confirmed Bowers was relieved of duty and an internal investigation has been launched due to the viral footage and public outcry.

title: IND vs ENG | 'That was out of character': Ponting on Gill controversy at Lord's
content: Ricky Ponting has voiced his support for Shubman Gill following a heated exchange with England's openers during the third Test at Lord's. Ponting acknowledged Gill's uncharacteristic aggression, attributing it to his desire to assert himself as captain and defend his team. He drew comparisons to Virat Kohli's leadership style, noting the pressures of playing in England.

title: 1,906 toilets, but where? Gujarat RTI activist flags Rs 2cr scam
content: A significant scam has been uncovered in Bharuch district, Gujarat, involving the misappropriation of approximately Rs 2 crore intended for toilet construction under government assistance programs. Retired schoolteacher Pravin Modi exposed the fraud through an RTI application, revealing that documents, including Aadhaar cards submitted for marriage certificates, were fraudulently used to apply for funds.

title: H-1B visa data reveals how much Nike pays its Software engineers in the US
content: Nike's H-1B visa data reveals software engineer salaries in the US, ranging from $139,845 to $301,378 based on specialization. The company's investment in tech roles reflects its digital transformation. While Nike sponsors roles in data, product, and design, primarily in Beaverton, Oregon, it's also undergoing restructuring, including tech division job cuts and outsourcing to third-party vendors.

title: Chess | Carlsen’s awkward reaction to Niemann’s entry at award ceremony goes viral - Watch
content: At the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas, Levon Aronian secured his first title, defeating Hans Niemann in the final and earning $200,000. A notable moment occurred when Magnus Carlsen conspicuously did not applaud Niemann during the award ceremony, reigniting their ongoing feud, but warmly applauded Aronian. Carlsen recovered to win the third-place match against Nakamura.

title: Chandigarh: 87-year-old retired top cop refuses to miss a day of cleaning
content: Despite retirement, 88-year-old Inderjit Singh Sidhu, a former DIG of Punjab Police, dedicates his mornings to cleaning Chandigarh's streets. Disappointed by Chandigarh's second-place ranking in the Swachh Survekshan 2024, he proactively picks up roadside garbage in Sector 49.

title: From ‘beautiful bills’ to economic revival: Trump marks 6 months in office
content: President Trump's second term has seen significant policy shifts, including substantial tax cuts and increased border security. The economy has added jobs primarily for native-born Americans, with rising blue-collar wages and substantial investment pledges. New trade agreements have been forged, and social policies have been implemented, addressing gender-affirming care and diversity programs, alongside initiatives promoting healthier food options.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk admits he had been ‘living in denial’
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared “game on,” signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: 15-year-old alleges rape by hockey coaches in Jajpur
content: In Jajpur district, police have detained four hockey trainers following a harrowing gang-rape allegation. A 15-year-old aspiring hockey player reported the incident, stating it occurred after a coaching session on July 3. The accused allegedly took her to a lodge, where they overpowered and assaulted her, further threatening her into silence.

title: Saiyaara box office collection day 5: Mohit Suri film may see a slight drop on Tuesday, after...
content: Mohit Suri's directorial 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has become a surprise hit, exceeding expectations. The film recorded the highest opening day for newcomers and earned ₹83 crore in its first weekend, a record for a love story. Despite a Monday drop, it still made ₹24 crore, and by Tuesday afternoon, the total collection reached ₹113.

title: 'Both sides committed to elevate partnership': MEA on PM Modi’s UK visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit the United Kingdom and the Maldives, commencing July 23. In the UK, he will meet with Prime Minister Keir Starmer and King Charles III to strengthen the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. Following this, PM Modi will travel to the Maldives for a state visit aimed at stabilising diplomatic relations with President Muizzu.

title: Astronomer scandal deepens: CEO quits, HR head stays; why Kristin Cabot not fired
content: Following a 'Kiss Cam' incident at a Coldplay concert, Astronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned, but HR head Kristin Cabot remains on leave, raising questions about her employment status. Legal and corporate considerations, including internal policies and potential legal risks, may be influencing the company's decision. Severance negotiations or Cabot's own account of events could also be factors.

title: 'Either you give everything or rest': Irfan Pathan to Jasprit Bumrah
content: Irfan Pathan has urged Jasprit Bumrah to elevate his performance in the crucial fourth Test against England, emphasizing the need for total commitment. Pathan highlighted Ben Stokes' and Jofra Archer's recent performances as examples of players pushing their limits for their team's success. He believes Bumrah's consistent match-winning contributions will solidify his legacy.

title: How EU ban on Russian-origin oil imports will hit India’s fuel exporters
content: The EU's upcoming ban on Russian-derived fuels, effective January 21, presents a temporary reprieve but poses challenges for Indian exporters due to its narrow classification. The EU requires proof of crude oil origin, potentially impacting fuel exports from India, a major importer of Russian oil.

title: Delhi tourist raped in McLeodganj hotel room
content: A tourist from Delhi was allegedly raped in her hotel room near McLeodganj, Dharamshala, by Shubham, a friend of her employer. The survivor, who was visiting Kangra with friends, stated that Shubham barged into her room while she was alone and sexually assaulted her. Police arrested Shubham, a Kangra native, after the woman filed a complaint.

title: Dhankhar's sudden exit: PM Modi wishes him good health
content: Prime Minister Modi conveyed his well wishes to Jagdeep Dhankhar, who stepped down from his position as Vice President due to health concerns. President Murmu accepted Dhankhar's resignation, and the Rajya Sabha acknowledged the Home Ministry's notification regarding the immediate effect of his departure.

title: Man in fur terrifies Japanese town after real bears kill two
content: A safety drill simulating a bear attack took place in Tochigi. This followed a tragic incident in Fukushima where a newspaper deliveryman died in a bear attack. The same bear was responsible for another death four years ago. Authorities issued a brown bear emergency alert. Hunting laws were eased. Residents are urged to be cautious and report sightings.

title: Bengaluru job lure: 56 women rescued from train in West Bengal
content: Authorities rescued fifty-six young women from a train at New Jalpaiguri station, suspecting human trafficking. The women, from West Bengal, were promised jobs in Bengaluru but were being sent to Bihar. Railway personnel noticed inconsistencies in their travel plans, leading to the arrest of two individuals accompanying the group, who failed to provide valid explanations or employment documents.

title: Kanwar Yatra: SC directs eateries to display only license & registration info
content: The Supreme Court has instructed dhaba and restaurant owners along the Kanwar Yatra route to adhere to Uttar Pradesh's mandate of displaying license and registration information. This directive follows a petition arguing that QR code requirements, revealing owner identities, could lead to discriminatory profiling.

title: Boeing 787, 737 inspection: AI completes fuel switch examination; claims 'no issues found'
content: Following a DGCA directive prompted by a recent Air India Boeing 787 crash, Air India has completed precautionary inspections of the fuel control switch locking mechanisms on its Boeing 787 and 737 aircraft. The inspections, initiated voluntarily on July 12 and completed within the DGCA's timeframe, found no issues with the locking mechanisms.

title: 'We're going to crush your economy': US Senator warns India, China, Brazil
content: US Senators Graham and Blumenthal, along with former President Trump, have warned India, China, and Brazil of potential economic sanctions, including tariffs up to 500%, for continuing to purchase discounted Russian oil and gas. These actions aim to cut off Russia's revenue amid the Ukraine war, with Trump threatening 100% secondary tariffs if a peace deal isn't reached soon.

title: Dhankhar quits: Did Nadda, Rijiju skipping BAC meet sour ties? BJP chief responds
content: JP Nadda refuted opposition claims linking senior ministers' absence from a Rajya Sabha meeting to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation. Nadda confirmed his and Kiren Rijiju's prior notification of their absence to Dhankhar's office. Congress leaders questioned the stated health reasons, suggesting deeper issues, while the BJP dismissed the allegations, highlighting a subsequent meeting of senior ministers.

title: 'Milestone moment': Army receives first batch of Apache helicopters from US
content: Three AH-64E Apache attack helicopters, part of a Rs 5,691 crore deal with the US, have arrived at Hindon Air Force Station, enhancing the Indian Army's offensive capabilities. These "tanks in the air" will be stationed in Jodhpur, where the Army raised its first Apache squadron. The remaining three Apaches are expected by the end of 2025.

title: Houthis launch missile at Israel's main airport; dock destroyed again
content: Israel intercepted a ballistic missile fired by Yemen's Houthi group targeting Ben Gurion International Airport near Tel Aviv, triggering air raid sirens. The Houthis claimed responsibility, stating they used a 'Palestine 2' hypersonic missile. This attack follows Israeli airstrikes on Houthi targets in Yemen, escalating regional tensions amid the Israel-Hamas conflict.

title: 'No one killed 200 people?': Shock, anger among victim families in Mumbai bombings
content: Families of victims of the 11/7 Mumbai train blasts expressed shock and anger over the acquittal of all accused, questioning who was responsible for the tragedy. Many voiced their disappointment with the justice system, highlighting the enduring pain and financial struggles caused by the loss of loved ones and permanent injuries.

title: Tom Brady switches tone on Instagram: From motivational quote to yearning post; NFL icon reveals
content: NFL legend Tom Brady, known for his self-discipline, recently shared motivational content on Instagram, followed by a humorous post expressing his longing for the NFL season. The post, highlighting the escalating frustration of the off-season, resonated with fans, garnering millions of views and sparking relatable comments about the highs and lows of football fandom.

title: Washroom fittings worth Rs 35 lakh at Kolkata's Oberoi Grand go missing
content: Luxury bathroom fittings, valued at Rs 35 lakh, were reported stolen from the Oberoi Grand hotel in Kolkata during its extensive renovation. The missing items, including showerheads and ceiling fans, were stored in a pantry on the fourth floor. Police suspect the theft occurred due to inadequate security measures amidst heavy construction activity, prompting an internal investigation by the hotel.

title: ‘Depriving Gazans of human dignity’: Over 20 nations and EU call for ceasefire
content: A coalition of 28 nations, alongside the EU Commissioner, urgently demands an immediate cessation of hostilities in Gaza, highlighting the escalating humanitarian crisis. They strongly condemned Israel's handling of aid, citing over 800 Palestinian deaths while seeking essential resources.

title: Prince William and Harry’s 20-year-old cousin found dead
content: Rosie Roche, a 20-year-old distant cousin of Princes William and Harry, was found dead at her family home in Wiltshire. A firearm was discovered nearby, and an inquest has been opened, but police have deemed the death non-suspicious. The Durham University student's passing is under investigation, with a private funeral planned.

title: Mumbai blasts: LeT or IM, household utensils or pressure cookers? Questions linger
content: The 2006 Mumbai train blasts case remains shrouded in controversy due to conflicting claims from the Maharashtra ATS and the Mumbai crime branch. While the ATS implicated SIMI and LeT, the crime branch later pointed to an Indian Mujaheeddin module. Key evidence like pressure cookers, allegedly used in the blasts, was questioned in court.

title: 2006 Mumbai bomb blasts: Maharashtra govt moves SC against Bombay HC verdict acquitting 12
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear Maharashtra's plea on July 25, challenging the Bombay High Court's acquittal of all 12 accused in the 2006 Mumbai train blasts case. The state, represented by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, emphasizes the urgency of the matter, especially since eight of the acquitted have been released. The Bombay High Court cited prosecution failures and procedural lapses in its decision, sparking political debate and concerns over justice.

title: Watch: Stranded UK fighter jet finally departs Kerala after month-long stay
content: A British F-35B Lightning fighter jet, grounded in Kerala due to a hydraulic fault since June 14, has successfully taken off after repairs. A UK technical team completed the work at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, with support from Indian authorities. The aircraft's extended stay garnered public attention, while the UK government expressed gratitude for India's collaboration.

title: China’s rare earth curbs hit: Apple AirPods production faces hurdles in India
content: Production of Apple AirPods in India may face challenges. This is due to China's restrictions on rare earth metal exports. Foxconn's Telangana facility is facing limited availability of dysprosium. Foxconn has raised the supply shortage issue with the Telangana government. The government has escalated the matter to DPIIT. Foxconn is seeking help to get the end user certificate certified.

title: Son's answer to mother being slapped: Murder a decade later in UP's Kalyanpur
content: In Lucknow's Kalyanpur, a decade-old grudge culminated in the daylight murder of a 32-year-old man. Police arrested five individuals, including the main accused, Anup alias Sonu Kashyap, who sought revenge for a 2015 incident where the victim allegedly assaulted his mother. The group attacked Manoj Kumar with iron rods and sticks.

title: Raj Thackeray's men remove Gujarati display board at Navi Mumbai BJP MLA's office
content: In Navi Mumbai, MNS members, joined by other political party workers, successfully pressured the removal of a Gujarati signboard from a Gujarat BJP MLA's office. Following an ultimatum, the group demonstrated at the NRI Sagari police station, demanding a Marathi replacement and action against those disrespecting Marathi identity.

title: Bihar hospital shooting: 2 murder suspects shot in encounter with cops; 7 held so far
content: Two suspects in the daylight murder of gangster Chandan Mishra at a Patna hospital were injured in a police encounter in Arrah. The suspects were part of a group that fatally shot Mishra, who was out on parole for surgery. Following arrests in Kolkata, police traced the gang, leading to the encounter and ongoing interrogations of ten suspects.

title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ trailer to debut with ‘Fantastic Four’ in theatres
content: James Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' trailer will debut exclusively in theaters this weekend, attached to 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps'. The film, releasing December 19, 2025, introduces new Na'vi tribes and a threat from the Ash People. Following the success of its predecessors, this third installment aims to cross the $2 billion mark, solidifying the franchise's box office dominance.

title: Hope to gift one someday: Sushmita Sen’s ex says can’t afford her diamonds
content: Despite ending their romantic relationship in 2021, Sushmita Sen and Rohman Shawl maintain a strong friendship, frequently seen together at events. Rohman humorously confessed he can't yet afford the 22-carat diamond Sushmita admires. They began as friends and remain so, with Rohman clarifying he's currently single but open to love, though assumptions about his relationship status complicate dating.

title: Iran admits nuclear facilities 'seriously damaged'; Trump warns 'will do it again'
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi admitted that US missile strikes last month caused "serious damage" to Iran's nuclear infrastructure, halting uranium enrichment. Despite the destruction, Iran vows to rebuild and resume enrichment, viewing it as a matter of national pride. President Trump responded by claiming vindication and demanding an apology from CNN for downplaying the strikes' effectiveness.

title: VP quits abruptly: Dhankhar caught govt unaware by allowing notice against Varma in RS
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar abruptly resigned, citing health reasons, just before completing two years in office. His resignation, submitted to President Droupadi Murmu, took effect immediately. The move has sparked speculation, especially given his recent cardiac procedure and fainting spell, despite appearing well on Monday. Dhankhar, who assumed office in August 2022, was expected to serve until 2027.

title: ‘Subject to divine intervention’: VP Dhankhar’s old video resurfaces; 10 days later he quits
content: Vice-president Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday evening, citing medical reasons, cutting short his term scheduled to end in August 2027. His resignation, which came on the first day of Parliament's Monsoon session, has sparked political speculation. An old video resurfaced where Dhankhar mentioned his retirement in August 2027, "subject to divine intervention".

title: Israeli strikes on Syria, Gaza: Caught off guard, Trump called Netanyahu to 'rectify'
content: US President Donald Trump expressed surprise at Israel's military actions in Syria and Gaza. White House confirmed Trump discussed the matter with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Israel stated the Syria operation aimed to pressure Syrian forces. A US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Syria has commenced. Netanyahu attributed the Gaza church strike to a stray missile.

title: Fans swoon over Darnell nurse’s wife's wedding post amid Oilers exit rumors
content: Darnell Nurse's personal life is in the spotlight as his wife Mikayla shares a loving moment from Warren Foegele's wedding. Simultaneously, the Edmonton Oilers are reportedly exploring trade options for Nurse, despite his key role on the team. His $9.25 million contract is a significant factor as the Oilers aim to optimize their roster for a Stanley Cup run.

title: Which NFL teams have the best -- and worst -- rosters? Let's stack all 32 projected lineups
content: We ranked every roster ahead of the season, then picked strengths, weaknesses, X factors and underrated players to know.

title: D.C. mayor 'focused' on RFK deal, not Trump talk
content: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser remains confident that the Commanders will return to the city but steered clear of President Donald Trump's threats to scuttle a stadium deal if the team does not return to its former name.

title: Ex-NFLPA boss resigns role at equity firm Carlyle
content: Former NFL Players Association executive director Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned his part-time consulting job with The Carlyle Group, one of a select group of league-approved firms seeking minority ownership in NFL franchises.

title: Injured Lillard glad to be 'back home' with Blazers
content: Damian Lillard spoke at a news conference Monday evening, saying it's meaningful to return to the city where he has spent most of his adult life.

title: Phillies win on catcher's interference call in 10th
content: Brandon Marsh scored on a catcher's interference call with the bases loaded in the 10th inning to give the Phillies a 3-2 walk-off win over the Red Sox.

title: Trade candidate Suarez continues homer binge
content: Eugenio Suarez, one of the most coveted bats ahead of the trade deadline, hit his fifth home run in three games for the Diamondbacks on Monday.

title: Cowboys' Parsons reports amid unsettled deal
content: Micah Parsons reported to training camp in Oxnard, California, on Monday, but what's not clear is whether Parsons will take part in practice when the Cowboys begin workouts Tuesday as he awaits a long-term extension.

title: Bengals prez: 'Foolishness' Stewart still unsigned
content: Bengals team president Mike Brown didn't mince words about the contract situation between the team and unsigned rookie Shemar Stewart.

title: Royals will call up Hill, 45, to start vs. Cubs
content: The Kansas City Royals plan to call up 45-year-old pitcher Rich Hill, who is 4-4 with a 5.36 ERA in nine starts for Triple-A Omaha, for a start against the Chicago Cubs on Tuesday at Wrigley Field, marking the left-hander's 21st season in the majors.

title: 😂 McDavid, Draisaitl play in beer league game
content: The Edmonton Oilers stars, not exactly playing at top intensity, suited up at Magna Centre in Newmarket, Ontario for a Wednesday pickup game.

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: A new No. 1 and best landing spots
content: A red-hot slugger on the move? An All-Star outfielder available? Our running list of who could be traded by the deadline has new names at the top.

title: Randle-Towns trade, Bridges to New York, Sixers add George: Regrading 2024 offseason moves
content: NBA expert Kevin Pelton looks back at 10 of the biggest trade and free agency moves and regrades them.

title: Does signing Emma Meesseman make the Liberty the 2025 WNBA title favorites?
content: The Lynx have been the 2025 front-runners, but Meesseman's return to the WNBA could tip the scales for New York.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Scottie Scheffler's unique dominance over golf continues at Open Championship
content: Scheffler's march on Royal Portrush was a masterclass and proof that his approach is unlike anyone else's.

title: England's semifinal record is the result of hard work and unity
content: England are in their sixth major semifinal in 10 years, but it's no accident. The togetherness of the squad has made it happen.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Philadelphia jumps Miami into first place
content: El Trafico may have been the game of the weekend, but the Philadelphia Union are the team to beat according to ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Numbers you need to know as you prep for draft day
content: Make of them what you will, but here are the stats from last season that you should be aware of as you prepare for your drafts.

title: Special game, unique uniforms: Threads for Braves, Reds revealed for MLB Speedway Classic
content: Atlanta's and Cincinnati's threads are largely unchanged, other than neat details that pay homage to the game.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Waiver wire: Maya Caldwell stepping up for Dream
content: Maya Caldwell is making the most of her increased opportunity with Rhyne Howard hurt for the Atlanta Dream and leads the list of fantasy pickups.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Man City fight for €80m Sporting star Hjulmand
content: Sporting CP captain Morten Hjulmand is wanted by both Manchester United and Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: How Hugo Ekitike ended up at Liverpool, and what they're getting
content: There is belief among Liverpool's decision-makers that Hugo Ekitike, 23, has all the tools to develop into one of Europe's top strikers. How did Liverpool decide to sign him and what can fans expect?

title: Man United confirm $94M Bryan Mbeumo signing
content: Manchester United announced the signing of forward Bryan Mbeumo from Brentford for a transfer fee sources told ESPN was worth in excess of £70m.

title: Sources: Man United to leave quartet off U.S. tour
content: Manchester United are set to axe Alejandro Garnacho, Antony, Tyrell Malacia and Jadon Sancho from their squad for the preseason tour of America, sources have told ESPN.

title: Source: Díaz wants to leave Liverpool  for Bayern
content: Luis Díaz remains determined to leave Liverpool this summer and hopes Bayern Munich will make a new offer to sign him, a source has told ESPN.

title: Navas joins Pumas from Newell's on 1-year deal
content: Costa Rica goalkeeper Keylor Navas has reached a deal to join Liga MX club Pumas from Newell's Old Boys, the Argentine club announced on Monday.

title: Sources: Liverpool finalising $106m Ekitike deal
content: Liverpool are finalising a move for Hugo Ekitike after they agreed a deal worth up to £79 million ($91m) with Eintracht Frankfurt, sources have told ESPN.

title: Arteta '100%' backs Arsenal's Partey protocols
content: Mikel Arteta has said he "100%" believes Arsenal followed the correct protocols regarding Thomas Partey's time at the club after the midfielder was charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

title: Stanway: Carter abusers not proper England fans
content: England midfielder Georgia Stanway said those who have sent racist abuse to Jess Carter are not proper fans of the Lionesses

title: Bonmatí proud of journey from meningitis to MVP
content: Aitana Bonmatí has told ESPN of her pride at recovering from viral meningitis to be named MVP during Spain's 2-0 European Championship quarterfinal win over hosts Switzerland.

title: Steelers unveil 1933-inspired throwback uniforms with yellow helmets and beige pants
content: Pittsburgh's new throwback look features bold chest stripes, a city crest patch and a rare yellow helmet.

title: UFC 318 fight grades: Did Poirier vs. Holloway live up to the hype?
content: Max Holloway vs. Dustin Poirier capped Saturday's pay-per-view, but did that matchup top ESPN's UFC 318 fight grades?

title: Waiver wire: Make some moves toward the Marlins
content: As the MLB season's second half gets into full swing, here are the players you should claim off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: From Kevin Durant's Team Durant to Carmelo Anthony's Team Melo, these next-gen AAU stars got next
content: NBA stars such as Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony sponsor their own high school AAU shoe-circuit teams.

title: A glimpse of what was to come: Stars who have showed out at Peach Jam
content: Before these stars went to college basketball and the NBA, they showed their stuff at the Nike Peach Jam.

title: India-US Interim Trade Deal Prospects Dim Ahead Of Tariff Deadline: Report
content: The prospects of an interim trade deal between India and the United States before Washington's August 1 deadline have dimmed, as talks remain deadlocked over tariff cuts on key agricultural and dairy products, two Indian government sources said.

title: "False, Misleading": DMK Denies Collecting Aadhaar For Membership Drive
content: A day after the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court restrained the DMK from collecting Aadhaar details and OTPs during its membership drive, the party has strongly denied the allegations in court, calling them "false and misleading."

title: The Legacy Of MiG-21, In Indian Air Force Service Since 1963
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has decided to retire the remaining squadrons of the Soviet-era MiG-21 fighter jets in September. They are being replaced with the single-engine Mk-1A.

title: "No Issues Found": Air India Inspects Fuel Control Switch On Boeing Jets
content: Weeks after India witnessed one of its worst air crashes in decades, Air India has said that it has completed its inspection of the locking mechanism of the fuel control switch on its Boeing 787 and Boeing 737 aircraft and found no issues.

title: A Fight Between 2 Groups, Then A Case Against Dead People In Madhya Pradesh
content: Madhya Pradesh police began an investigation into an FIR registered in a dispute case in Vidisha district as a complaint was received stating that two people named in the case were said to have died around a decade ago, a police officer said.

title: Inside Story: What Led To Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's Shock Exit
content: An Opposition-sponsored motion to remove a judge after a massive cash recovery from his home set in motion the chain of events eventually leading to Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar's shock resignation last night.

title: "After Watching Saiyaara...": Memes Fly As UK's F-35B Takes Off From Kerala
content: After five weeks of being grounded in Kerala, the British Royal Navy's F-35B jet finally took off from Thiruvananthapuram airport this morning.

title: India Needs $2.4 Trillion For Climate Infrastructure By 2050: World Bank
content: India needs to invest more than $2.4 trillion by 2050 to build climate-resilient urban infrastructure, as its fast-expanding cities face growing challenges from extreme weather events linked to climate change, the World Bank said on Tuesday.

title: Who Is Gita Gopinath, IMF's No 2 Economist Set To Return To Harvard
content: Calling her stint at the IMF a "once in a lifetime opportunity," Ms Gopinath thanked IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva and her predecessor, Christine Lagarde, who appointed her as chief economist.

title: President Murmu Accepts Jagdeep Dhankhar's Resignation From Veep Post
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation as Vice President of India has been accepted by the President of India, Droupadi Murmu.

title: Chinese-Born Engineer Pleads Guilty To Stealing US Trade Secrets
content: A Chinese-born US researcher pleaded guilty on Monday to stealing trade secrets, including technology used to detect nuclear missile launches, the Justice Department said.

title: Time Ripe For Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis To Reshuffle Cabinet: Team Uddhav
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) on Tuesday said it was time for Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to reshuffle his cabinet and shunt out five to six ministers who have been linked to various controversies.

title: 10 Reasons Why Apache Helicopter Is Considered One Of The Deadliest In World
content: This is the first time the Indian Army will operate the Apache helicopters. The Indian Air Force already operates 22 of the heavy attack helicopters.

title: Making Of India's Space Hero Shubhanshu Shukla, "Incredibly Intelligent, Wicked Smart"
content: Shubhanshu Shukla's journey from the National Defence Academy to the stars is a testament to brilliance, resilience, and adaptability.

title: Prince Harry, Prince William's Cousin Found Dead With "Firearm Nearby": Report
content: Rosie Roche, a distant cousin of Prince William and Prince Harry, was found dead at her family's Norton, Wiltshire home with a "firearm nearby" on July 14, according to reports.

title: This European Nation Is World's Safest Country, Check India's Ranking
content: Andorra, a tiny European nation situated between France and Spain in the Pyrenees mountains, was found to be the world's safest country of 2025, according to Numbeo Safety Index.

title: Man Accuses Wife Of Attempt To Murder, Gets Booked Under Child Marriage Act
content: According to police sources, the Raichur Women's Police have registered a case against the husband, Tataiah, after confirming that he had married a minor girl aged 15.8 years.

title: Vasuki Indicus: All About The Longest Snake To Have Ever Lived
content: The fossil of an ancient serpent, Vasuki Indicus, found along the Kutch coast in the Indian state of Gujarat two decades ago, has offered some never-before-known insights into the evolution of the reptile.

title: 3 Apache Choppers, Painted In Desert Camo, Arrive For Indian Army From US
content: The Indian Army has received the first batch of three Apache helicopters that will massively boost its offensive and operational capabilities.

title: UC Berkeley Professor's Ex-Wife Convinced Lover To Kill Him: Report
content: A man detained in connection with the murder of a UC Berkeley Professor in Greece has confessed to carrying out the cold-blooded killing for his lover, the former wife of Przemyslaw Jeziorski.

title: Ahmedabad airport receives bomb threat
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Euro 2025 semifinals: How do you tactically beat each team?
content: the quarterfinals produced very exciting matchups at the 2025 edition of the women's Euros . the 2022 finalists, Germany and England , needed penalties to progress to the last four . but who will emerge victorious and make it to the final? Here are the strengths and weaknesses of the teams .

title: What's next for Max Holloway and Paulo Costa after UFC 318?
content: max Holloway wins by unanimous decision over Dustin Poirier . the title has been successfully defended for the first time . there is one currently sitting outside the lightweight title picture who should be next . click here for all the latest boxing news .

title: From Aaron Rodgers to the tush push, let's catch up on an active offseason
content: it's technically the offseason, but there has been plenty of action around the league in the five months since confetti rained down on the Philadelphia Eagles in new Orleans . there's going to be a lot of mail rerouted to and from Pittsburgh after this offseason . general manager Omar Khan spent the last couple of months wheeling and dealing .

title: Astros' Isaac Paredes heads to IL; Diamondbacks activate Ketel Marte
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a few spots may be wet, most likely the Chicago White Sox at Tampa Bay Rays and the St. Louis Cardinals visiting the Colorado Rockies .

title: Fights we want to see: Usyk-Parker, Teofimo-Rolly and Joshua-Paul?
content: Oleksandr Usyk knocks out Daniel Dubois in round 5 to become undisputed world heavyweight champion again . we turn to the remaining boxing calendar in 2025 . canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford will meet in the biggest fight of the year on sept. 13 .

title: Steering through history: E.V. Arjunan remembers his time as driver with V.S. Achuthanandan
content: From early morning rides to late-night returns, Arjunan chauffeured the veteran communist leader across Kerala, through political storms and quiet moments alike

title: Deputy Chairman Harivansh chairs Rajya Sabha proceedings after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned as Vice-President
content: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh leads morning session after Vice-President Dhankhar resigns due to health reasons

title: Revised schedule issued for admissions in M. Tech courses
content: Registration-cum-payment of processing fee for GATE/GPAT score card upload remain open till July 25, 2025

title: Do not borrow PT periods for your lessons, T.N. Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin appeals to teachers
content: “My request to teachers on behalf of the students is only one: I urge you not to borrow the PT period to teach your lessons. I am making this request in the presence of the Minister for School Education,” Mr. Udhayanidhi said, garnering a round of applause from students

title: Delhi government hikes cash awards for Olympic winners, approves free laptop scheme for students
content: The decisions were taken during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Chief Minister Rekha Gupta at the Delhi Secretariat

title: Centre announces ₹1,490 support price for Totapuri mangoes
content: Union Minister of State for Rural Development and Communications Pemmasani Chandrasekhar said the move will safeguard farmers against price crashes, ensure fair returns, and strengthen rural livelihoods

title: V.S. Achuthanandan: A life of conscience and courage
content: V.S. believed ideas should determine action, not remain confined to texts or slogans. His approach to Marxism was thoughtful and practical, not rigid or ceremonial

title: Air India says completed inspection of fuel switch locking system on Boeing fleet, no issues found
content: Air India has a total of 33 wide-body Boeing 787s, while Air India Express has around 75 narrow-body 737s.

title: Who are they, what is their party position: Tharoor hits back at K. Muraleedharan
content: First of all, it seems to me that the people saying this also have to have a basis for saying this, says Congress MP Shashi Tharoor

title: With the waitlist for kidney transplants remaining high in T.N., doctors slot prevention as top priority
content: Chronic Kidney Disease is a global crisis and is increasing exponentially due to lifestyle disorders such as diabetes, hypertension, obesity and environmental pollution say doctors, underscoring the need for prevention through an active, healthy lifestyle from a young age

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar always defended farmers, was enthusiastic about judicial reforms
content: The Vice-President, who resigned on July 21, had reminded MPs that the Constitution has given privileges to MPs, but this privilege is not unqualified

title: What is Article 67(a) of the Indian Constitution invoked by Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar?
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar, who is also the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha, resigned hours after he presided over the first sitting of the Rajya Sabha as chairperson during the Monsoon Session of Parliament.

title: Madras High Court orders reissue of NTK leader Seeman’s lost passport
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says, mere pendency of criminal cases cannot be a reason to deny renewal/reissuance of passport

title: Indian Air Force to retire MIG-21 jets in September
content: According to sources, there are plan to replace MiG-21 jets by the indigenously developed Tejas Mk1A fighter aircraft.

title: Kerala drags feet on snakebite surveillance; yet to declare snakebites as notifiable disease despite Centre’s directive
content: The delay, experts warn, could seriously undermine the State’s ambitious goal of eliminating snakebite fatalities within the next five years

title: Marine engineer arrested for dowry harassment and domestic violence in Vellore
content: A woman has accused her husband of pushing her off the terrace following a heated argument over additional dowry in Vellore

title: LIVE: Vice-President Dhankhar resigns | Hope Dhankhar’s successor will do justice in real sense to V-P’s chair: Omar
content: In the case of death, removal or resignation of the Vice-President, the Constitution does not provide any method of succession, apart from a fresh election, only that in such an event the Deputy Chairman can function as the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha

title: Home Ministry notifies resignation of Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar: Rajya Sabha informed
content: Soon after the House met for the Question Hour at 12 noon, Ghanshyam Tiwari, who was in the Chair, informed members about the notification

title: SC directs all hotel owners along Kanwar Yatra route to display licences
content: The bench said it was not going into the other issues of displaying the name of the hotel or dhaba owner and the QR code as Tuesday is the last day of the Kanwar Yatra

title: As families migrate, Erode hamlet without roads or power left with only one student
content: The village is accessible only after a two-hour journey by pick-up van along a rugged nine-kilometre path from Kadambur

title: Kerala High Court mandates air blank test with ‘0.000’ reading before breathalyser use for drunken driving cases
content: Court says primary goal of air blank test is to verify that breathalyser device is functioning correctly and is not influenced by residual alcohol from previous tests

title: Army gets first batch of Apache helicopters from U.S.
content: The induction of first batch of three advanced combat helicopters Apache AH-64E will bolster Army operational capabilities along Western Border

title: Opposition protests in Parliament against Bihar’s Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls
content: In the Lok Sabha, Congress MP Manickam Tagore moved a notice on the Special Intensive Revision, but the House adjourned within minutes

title: Four Indian fishermen from Rameswaram arrested by Sri Lankan Navy
content: The police said the trawler was stopped by a Sri Lankan Navy patrol boat at a location between Dhanushkodi and Thalaimannar for allegedly crossing the IMBL

title: Vice-President office was informed of his, Rijiju's inability to attend BAC meeting, says Nadda
content: J.P. Nadda’s remarks came after Congress leader Jairam Ramesh raised questions over the absence of the leader of the Rajya Sabha and Mr. Rijiju at the BAC.

title: 2006 train blasts case: Supreme Court to hear Maharashtra’s plea against Bombay HC verdict on July 24
content: Bombay High Court on July 21 acquitted all 12 accused, saying the prosecution utterly failed to prove the case and it was “hard to believe the accused committed the crime”

title: Wanted criminal arrested after encounter in Delhi’s Ghazipur
content: The accused, identified as Khemchand (35), a resident of Seelampur in northeast Delhi, was wanted in over a dozen criminal cases and had been absconding for a long time, police said

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 2: Both Houses of Parliament adjourned till tomorrow amid Opposition protests
content: Both Houses of Parliament were adjourned till July 23. The Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha will again meet at 11 a.m. on Wednesday (July 23, 2025).

title: Retired employees of Karnatak University Dharwad not getting pension on time
content: Taking exception to irregularity in payment of pension, members of Karnatak University Retired Non-Teaching Employees’ Association and Pensioners’ Association stage protest in front of administrative office

title: Presidential Reference concerns all States, will answer all questions raised: Supreme Court
content: The Bench comprising Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai, and Justices Surya Kant, Vikram Nath, P.S. Narasimha and A.S. Chandurkar said they will hear the matter in mid-August

title: Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls should be cancelled, says economist Jean Dreze
content: A public hearing was organised in Patna in which people from 14 districts shared their experience and problem. Many voters who were not literate had to pay someone around Rs 100 to fill up per form.

title: Karnataka Transport Commissioner suspends three Sakleshpur officials for celebrating birthday of driving school principal-cum-agent on office premises
content: Transport Commissioner A.M. Yogeesh issued orders suspending S.N. Madhura, ARTO, N.R. Asha, motor vehicle inspector, and M.K. Girish, superintendent, on July 21

title: V.S. Achuthanandan’s mortal remains moved to Durbar Hall at Secretariat to lie in state
content: Scores of workers walked alongside the hearse from the veteran communist leader’s residence near Barton Hill in Thiruvananthapuram to the Secretariat precincts. Ministers and top party apparatchiks accompanied the hearse in their official cars

title: Supreme Court issues notices to Union and States on Presidential reference on President, Governor’s powers
content: The Bench comprising Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai, and Justices Surya Kant, Vikram Nath, P.S. Narasimha, and A.S. Chandurkar heard the matter

title: Meta, Google officials fail to depose before ED; called again on July 28
content: The ED is investigating more than a dozen cases linked to illegal gambling and betting platforms across the country

title: Congress says ‘far deeper reasons’ behind Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar’s resignation
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that Mr. Dhankhar was not personally informed about Union Ministers J.P. Nadda and Kiren Rijiju not attending the second Business Advisory Committee meeting at 4.30 p.m. on Monday (July 21, 2025)

title: Four killed, several injured in auto collision near Kanamarlapudi in Andhra Pradesh
content: The deceased have been identified as: Brahmayya Battula, 32, Anjamma Battula, 32, Nagamarthamma Battula, 40, and Muthyallamma Battula, 60, all hailing from Karumanchi village.

title: What is the legal status of right to vote? | Explained
content: What is the difference between a constitutional right and a statutory right? What does Section 62 of the Representation of the People Act, 1951 provide? What did Justice Ajay Rastogi state in his partial dissent in the Anoop Baranwal case?

title: Earthquake hits Faridabad, tremors felt in Delhi-NCR
content: The National Centre for Seismology said an earthquake of 3.2 magnitude was recorded at 6 a.m., with Faridabad as its epicentre; tremors were felt in Delhi, NCR but no reports of any damage

title: BITS-Hyderabad startup delivers indigenous combat drones to Indian Army
content: The startup, born at BITS Pilani Hyderabad campus and run by Jayant Khatri and Sourya Choudhury, delivered the units within two months of beginning operations, according to an official disclosure

title: Jangaon schools to follow U-shape seating for inclusive learning
content: “This initiative represents a powerful shift, not just in furniture layout, but in educational philosophy. In Jangaon’s classrooms today, every child matters,” Jangaon District Collector Rizwan Basha Shaik said

title: India’s water, energy demand spotlight risk of human-induced quakes
content: When groundwater is pumped out, the mass of water maintaining the pressure under the earth is removed, creating jolts on the surface

title: CPI(M) West Bengal State secretary Md. Salim slams Mamata for ‘waking up late’ to Bengali identity issue
content: The Left leader says BJP, RSS have long targeted regional identities for years; calls Mamata’s language movement a poll gimmick

title: Revision of Bihar poll rolls riddled with violations, should be cancelled: Jean Drèze
content: In multiple instances, voters discovered that their forms had already been submitted by the BLO. Even their signatures on the forms were not taken; illiterate voters reported having to pay someone to fill out the form

title: ‘Innovations, creativity among youth key factors to promote climate action’
content: “An environmentally sustainable economy could be evolved with proper resource management, collaborations and upskilling”

title: Congress-AAP lock horns over land pooling scheme in Punjab
content: Leader of Opposition, Congress’s Partap Singh Bajwa, addressing the demonstrators, alleged that the AAP’s land pooling policy is nothing but an outright attempt to rob Punjab’s agricultural land

title: V.S. Achuthanandan’s body shifted from AKG centre to son’s private residence
content: Achuthanandan’s family will keep an overnight vigil until Tuesday (July 22, 2025) morning, when party workers will shift his body to lie in state at the Durbar Hall at 8:30 a.m.

title: Hindus in Assam will become a minority in 10 years: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The Chief Minister said the State government has reclaimed 1.29 lakh bighas of land from squatters so far

title: Opposition demands answers from PM in Rajya Sabha, stages a walkout
content: Speaking on the issue Congress president and Leader of the Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge said that terrorists who carried out the Pahalgam attack have neither been caught nor killed till date; he also said that U.S. President Donald Trump’s claims on ceasefire during Operation Sindoor were humiliating for the country

title: What does the Constitution say about the vice-presidential elections when a V-P resigns
content: Vice-President is elected by an Electoral College consisting of members of the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha. Members of the Electoral College can vote according to their choice and are not bound by any party whip

title: 610 antiquities retrieved from six countries including U.S. during 2020-24: Govt
content: The total number spanning the six countries— the U.S., the U.K., Australia, Canada, Italy and Thailand— for 2020-24 stands at 610

title: Bird-hit incidents at Hyderabad airport lower than in major Indian cities
content: In contrast, Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport reported the highest number, with a total of 695 bird strikes in the same period

title: Tamil Nadu to set up hornbill conservation centre at Anamalai Tiger Reserve
content: An official release said hornbills, often known as “farmers of the forest”, play a crucial ecological role as seed dispersers, helping regenerate native forests

title: Dharmasthala burials: Ashok says temple should not be tarnished while targeting individuals
content: Leader of Opposition pointed out that the government of Karnataka set up an SIT in response to an individual’s claim of having buried thousands of bodies in the Dharmasthala area

title: Keeladi report under review, Union Ministry of Culture tells Lok Sabha
content: Union Minister for Culture Gajendra Singh Shekhawat says comments of experts have been shared with the lead archaeologist, which are still to be finalised

title: Action plan launched to curb pollution in Kadambrayar, says Environment dept.
content: The action plan was formulated by the district-level technical committee comprising representatives from the Irrigation dept., PCB, and the Departments of Industries and Local Self Governments, along with the District Collector

title: STP projects to check pollution of Vembanad Lake hit by hurdles
content: Implementation stalls despite tribunal pressure, with key treatment projects in Kochi lagging due to rain-related delays, design clearances, and infrastructure setbacks

title: ED secures conviction in money-laundering case involving NALCO CMD and others
content: Among those arraigned in the case were Mr. Srivastava’s wife Chandni Srivastava, Bhushan Lai Bajaj, and his wife Anita Bajaj

title: Desilting and Restoration of Chilavannoor, Market canals to begin shortly
content: Project under Integrated Urban Regeneration and Water Transport System to be executed using ₹28.77 crore allotted by KIIFB

title: People of Tamil Nadu expect only single-party rule in 2026, says Edappadi Palaniswami
content: AIADMK general secretary downplays BJP’s pre-poll assertion about forming a coalition government; says his appeal to all like-minded parties to join hands with AIADMK to defeat DMK applied for Vijay’s Tamizhaga Vettri Kazhagam and Seeman’s Naam Tamilar Katchi; accuses Chief Minister M.K. Stalin of not understanding sufferings of people

title: Committee condoles death of ‘key figure behind Moolampilly Rehabilitation Package’
content: The condolence note recalls how V.S. Achuthanandan reversed course after initially criticising the protest, ultimately shaping a landmark rehabilitation package through dialogue and policy action

title: BJP set ‘honeytraps’ to bring down MVA government, alleges Sanjay Raut
content: The police were conducting raids to find four pen drives and two CDs having sensitive footage involving sitting legislators, all of which eventually linked to Praful Lodha, the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said

title: Ashim Kumar Ghosh sworn in as Haryana Governor
content: Mr. Ghosh, a distinguished academician and experienced political leader, served as the Head of the Department of Political Science at a reputed college in Kolkata in West Bengal for nearly four decades

title: V.S. Achuthanandan helped transform socio-economic, political landscape of Kerala, says Antony
content: VS’ life and struggles and the torture he endured in the vanguard of the communist agitations for bonded agriculture workers in Kuttanad are unequalled and historical, says the senior Congress leader, reminiscing about listening to the communist leader’s speeches in Cherthala as a school student

title: Aadhaar, voter ID and ration cards can’t be accepted as ‘standalone documents’ for SIR: ECI
content: The electoral body was responding to allegations raised by petitioners that SIR was ‘citizenship screening’ and would lead to mass disenfranchisement

title: ‘Madhya Pradesh elections could be stolen, just as in Maharashtra’: Rahul Gandhi
content: In Maharashtra during the Lok Sabha polls, the Congress and our coalition swept the elections and four months after that, the BJP sweeps

title: Thiruvananthapuram witnesses an outpouring of emotions as a dear leader departs
content: Crowd filled the entire breadth of the road that leads from the Kerala University to the General Hospital as his mortal remains were brought to the old AKG centre. Slogans in his praise rent the air for long, a testimony to the immense affinity the people had towards the man

title: Dhankhar's resignation 'totally unexpected', more to it than meets the eye: Congress
content: In his resignation letter to President Droupadi Murmu Jagdeep Dhankhar said he was stepping down with immediate effect

title: Any move to curtail trade union rights will be opposed: BMS
content: Hiranmay Pandya, the president of the RSS-affiliated trade union, says the organisation is open to work with other trade unions too on the issue of their rights

title: Official intervention saves anaemic woman who refused hospital care for 10th pregnancy in Krishnagiri village
